div.p: ROAN in the manege, A roan horſe is one of a
bay, ſorrel, or black colour, with grey or white ſpots interſperſed very thick. When this party-coloured

, coat is accompanied with a black head and black extremities, he is called a roan horſe with a black-a-moor , 's head: and if the ſame mixture is predominant upon a deep ſorrel, he is called claret roan.
